what: Cleaning up the axis on a chart before exporting as an svg
title: Making It Easier To Use ggplot2 Outputs In Graphic Design Software
text: default gaps axis data displayed chart. Often editing chart hand design software want data fit snuggly axis. clean_axis() helps without getting involved details ggplot works.
code: # import packages library(ggdesign) library(ggplot2)  # get a colour to use in the plot from the ggdesign palette fill_colour <- get_colours(1)  # create a very basic plot for demonstration  p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg)) +     geom_histogram(fill = fill_colour)  # show the issue with the gaps p +   ggtitle("By default there are gaps between the axis and the chart") # addressing the issue with axis clean p +    clean_axis() + # removes the gaps   ggtitle("The gaps can be removed to make everything look neater")

what: Exporting a chart as an svg to edit
title: Making It Easier To Use ggplot2 Outputs In Graphic Design Software
text: editing chart design software, paying attention details chart structure can really enhance overall design aesthetic. ggdesign provides theme_edit help focus design decisions. deliberately applies inappropriate offputting colours structural elements chart (inc axis gridlines). , import chart design software forced consider make deliberate changes structural elements. group elements (e.g. minor gridlines) coloured , can use select colour design software edit together.
code: # create a slightly different chart for demonstration  # the bars are transparent in this chart so you can see how theme_edit() # changed the structure of the chart p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg)) +     geom_histogram(fill = fill_colour,                     alpha = 0.2) # fade bars into background  p +    clean_axis() +   theme_edit() + # brings the chart structure to your attention   ggtitle("The bars are faded out in this example so you can see the structure of the chart") # save the chart as svg for editting ggsave("man/figures/chart_to_edit.svg")
